title: Sports Entertainment Group Full Year 2025 Earnings: AU$0.018 loss per share (vs AU$0.003 loss in FY 2024)
description: Sports Entertainment Group ( ASX:SEG ) Full Year 2025 Results Key Financial Results Revenue: AU$110.2m (down 12% from...
content:
• AU$0.018 loss per share (further deteriorated from AU$0.003 loss in FY 2024).

Trump has pledged to "unleash" American oil and gas and these 15 US stocks have developments that are poised to benefit.

All figures shown in the chart above are for the trailing 12 month (TTM) period

Sports Entertainment Group shares are up 13% from a week ago.

It's necessary to consider the ever-present spectre of investment risk. We've identified 2 warning signs with Sports Entertainment Group (at least 1 which is a bit unpleasant), and understanding these should be part of your investment process.

Have feedback on this article? Concerned about the content? Get in touch with us directly. Alternatively, email editorial-team (at) simplywallst.com.

summary: The article discusses the potential for Sports Entertainment Group, with its shares up 13% from a week ago. The article suggests that the company's full-year loss per share is predicted to be at least AU$0.01 per year 2025, with a further deterioration from the previous year's loss of $0.02 per year. This article is not intended to be financial advice, but it focuses on historical data and analyst forecasts.
shortSummary: Sports Entertainment Group shares rose 13% amid rising investor confidence due to President Trump's pledge to "freeze" American oil and gas, despite ongoing losses and potential market volatility.

scraped_sources.text:
Results
22
Midstream oil and gas companies, specifically pipeline operators, are well-positioned to benefit from Trump’s executive orders on fossil fuels enacted in early 2025. – – These policies aim to accelerate infrastructure development by streamlining environmental reviews and permitting processes, such as those under the National Environmental Policy Act (NEPA). The declaration of a "national energy emergency" further empowers these companies by prioritizing pipeline and storage projects to support increased production from newly accessible federal lands and waters. – – The push to "unleash American energy" also amplifies demand for midstream services as upstream production ramps up, particularly in regions like Alaska and offshore areas reopened for drilling. Pipelines and storage facilities will be critical to moving larger volumes of oil and gas efficiently, especially with the renewed emphasis on LNG exports to meet global demand.

Sports Entertainment Group Limited engages in sports media content and entertainment business in Australia and New Zealand. The company operates through Media, Complementary Services, and Sports Teams segments. It also operates various live sports channels, TV shows, and podcasts.

argos_summary: Trump’s 2025 executive orders to accelerate fossil‑fuel infrastructure are expected to boost midstream oil and gas companies, with pipeline operators such as Williams, Kinder Morgan, and others poised to benefit from streamlined NEPA reviews and a national energy emergency designation. The article lists 22 midstream firms that could see higher demand for transportation and storage services as upstream production ramps up, especially in Alaska and reopened offshore drilling areas. In contrast, Sports Entertainment Group Limited in Australia reported a worsening loss of AU$0.018 per share for FY 2025, a decline in earnings growth, and a 28% share‑price rise in July amid mixed investor sentiment. The company’s financials show negative earnings, modest debt, and a high beta, indicating volatility relative to the broader media market.
